title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: ggcatppuccin provides three theme variants different levels minimalism.

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: standard theme_catppuccin() includes grid lines full axis decoration:
code: ggplot(economics, aes(date, unemploy)) +   geom_line(color = catppuccin_palette("mocha", "blue")) +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "US Unemployment Over Time",     x = "Date",     y = "Unemployed (thousands)"   )

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: theme_catppuccin_minimal() removes grid lines default, optional control:  Add major grid lines:
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point(color = catppuccin_palette("mocha", "mauve"), size = 2) +   theme_catppuccin_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Minimal Theme - No Grid",     x = "Displacement",     y = "Highway MPG"   ) ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy)) +   geom_point(color = catppuccin_palette("mocha", "mauve"), size = 2) +   theme_catppuccin_minimal(grid = "major") +   labs(     title = "Minimal Theme - Major Grid",     x = "Displacement",     y = "Highway MPG"   )

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: theme_catppuccin_void() removes axes grid, perfect maps heatmaps:
code: ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_c() +   theme_catppuccin_void() +   labs(title = "Old Faithful Density")

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: Sequential scales go base color accent:  Try different accents:
code: df <- expand.grid(x = 1:10, y = 1:10) df$z <- df$x + df$y  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = z)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_sequential(accent = "green") +   theme_catppuccin_minimal() +   labs(title = "Sequential Scale - Base to Green") colors <- c("blue", "mauve", "peach") plots <- lapply(colors, function(col) {   ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = z)) +     geom_tile() +     scale_fill_catppuccin_sequential(accent = col) +     theme_catppuccin_void() +     labs(title = col) })  if (requireNamespace("patchwork", quietly = TRUE)) {   patchwork::wrap_plots(plots, nrow = 1) }

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: Diverging scales use two accent colors neutral midpoint:
code: df$z_centered <- df$z - mean(df$z)  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = z_centered)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_diverging(low_color = "blue", high_color = "red") +   theme_catppuccin_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Diverging Scale",     subtitle = "Blue (low) to Red (high) through base color"   )

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: Extract specific colors custom use:
code: # Get specific colors my_colors <- catppuccin_palette("mocha", c("blue", "red", "green")) print(my_colors) #> [1] "#89b4fa" "#f38ba8" "#a6e3a1"  # Use in a plot ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_manual(values = my_colors) +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(title = "Custom Color Selection")

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: See colors flavor:  Compare flavors:
code: show_catppuccin_palette("mocha", type = "accents") compare_flavors(type = "accents")

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
text: can customize themes using standard ggplot2 theme modifications:
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy, fill = class)) +   geom_boxplot() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   theme(     legend.position = "none",     axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1),     plot.title.position = "plot"   ) +   labs(     title = "Highway MPG by Class",     subtitle = "With custom theme modifications",     x = NULL,     y = "Highway MPG"   )

title: Customizing Catppuccin Themes
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(cyl), size = hp)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Multiple Aesthetics",     x = "Weight (1000 lbs)",     y = "Miles per Gallon",     color = "Cylinders",     size = "Horsepower"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("mocha")  ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 3, alpha = 0.7) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Iris Sepal Measurements",     subtitle = "Mocha flavor",     x = "Sepal Length (cm)",     y = "Sepal Width (cm)"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("frappe")  ggplot(economics, aes(date, unemploy / 1000)) +   geom_line(color = catppuccin_palette("frappe", "blue"), linewidth = 1) +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "US Unemployment Rate",     subtitle = "Frappé flavor",     x = NULL,     y = "Unemployed (millions)"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("latte")  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, fill = class)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Vehicle Count by Class",     subtitle = "Latte flavor",     x = NULL,     y = "Count"   ) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy, fill = class)) +   geom_catppuccin_boxplot() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Highway MPG Distribution by Class",     subtitle = "Macchiato flavor",     x = NULL,     y = "Highway MPG"   ) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("mocha")  ggplot(diamonds[sample(nrow(diamonds), 1000), ], aes(cut, price, fill = cut)) +   geom_catppuccin_violin() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   scale_y_log10() +   theme_catppuccin() +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Diamond Price Distribution by Cut",     subtitle = "Mocha flavor, log scale",     x = "Cut Quality",     y = "Price (log scale)"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("frappe")  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_c() +   theme_catppuccin_minimal() +   labs(     title = "Old Faithful Eruption Patterns",     subtitle = "Frappé flavor with continuous scale",     x = "Waiting Time (min)",     y = "Eruption Duration (min)",     fill = "Density"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("mocha")  df <- data.frame(   x = rep(1:10, 10),   y = rep(1:10, each = 10) ) df$z <- (df$x - 5.5) * (df$y - 5.5)  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = z)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_diverging() +   theme_catppuccin_void() +   labs(     title = "Diverging Color Scale",     subtitle = "Mocha flavor",     fill = "Value"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("latte")  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.7) +   facet_wrap(~ year) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Fuel Efficiency by Year",     subtitle = "Latte flavor with facets",     x = "Displacement (L)",     y = "Highway MPG"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  ggplot(mpg, aes(manufacturer, fill = class)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Vehicle Classes by Manufacturer",     subtitle = "Macchiato flavor",     x = NULL,     y = "Count",     fill = "Class"   ) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("frappe")  ggplot(diamonds, aes(price, fill = cut)) +   geom_density(alpha = 0.6) +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   scale_x_log10() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Diamond Price Density by Cut",     subtitle = "Frappé flavor",     x = "Price (log scale)",     y = "Density",     fill = "Cut"   )

title: Gallery of Examples
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("mocha")  ggplot(mpg, aes(class, hwy)) +   geom_catppuccin_boxplot(alpha = 0.5) +   geom_jitter(width = 0.2, alpha = 0.3,               color = catppuccin_palette("mocha", "peach")) +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Highway MPG with Box and Points",     subtitle = "Mocha flavor, multiple geoms",     x = NULL,     y = "Highway MPG"   ) +   theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

title: Gallery of Examples
text: Compare plot across flavors:
code: make_plot <- function(flavor) {   set_catppuccin_flavor(flavor)   ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +     geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.7) +     scale_color_catppuccin() +     theme_catppuccin_minimal() +     labs(title = tools::toTitleCase(flavor)) +     guides(color = "none") }  if (requireNamespace("patchwork", quietly = TRUE)) {   plots <- lapply(c("latte", "frappe", "macchiato", "mocha"), make_plot)   patchwork::wrap_plots(plots, ncol = 2) }

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: ggcatppuccin provides Catppuccin color palettes themes ggplot2, allowing create beautiful, cohesive visualizations minimal effort. package supports four official Catppuccin flavors: Latte, Frappé, Macchiato, Mocha.

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
code: # Install from GitHub remotes::install_github("ZhenyaKosovan/ggcatppuccin")

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggcatppuccin)

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: simplest way use ggcatppuccin add theme_catppuccin() color scale plot:
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point(size = 2.5, alpha = 0.8) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Fuel Efficiency by Engine Size",     subtitle = "Using Catppuccin Mocha theme",     x = "Displacement (L)",     y = "Highway MPG"   )

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: can specify Catppuccin flavor use:
code: ggplot(mpg, aes(class, fill = class)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin(flavor = "latte") +   theme_catppuccin(flavor = "latte") +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Vehicle Classes",     subtitle = "Using Catppuccin Latte theme",     x = NULL,     y = "Count"   )

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: avoid repeating flavor argument, set session-wide default:  can still override default specifying flavor explicitly:
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  # Now all functions use macchiato by default ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +  # Uses macchiato   theme_catppuccin() +         # Uses macchiato   labs(     title = "Fuel Efficiency vs Weight",     color = "Cylinders"   ) ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_catppuccin(flavor = "frappe") +  # Override to frappe   theme_catppuccin(flavor = "frappe") +   labs(title = "Iris Dataset - Frappé Flavor")

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: Use scale_color_catppuccin() color aesthetic scale_fill_catppuccin() fill aesthetic:
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("mocha")  ggplot(diamonds[sample(nrow(diamonds), 1000), ], aes(cut, fill = cut)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Diamond Cut Distribution",     x = "Cut Quality",     y = "Count"   )

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: continuous data, use _c variants:
code: ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_c() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Old Faithful Eruption Density",     x = "Waiting Time (min)",     y = "Eruption Time (min)"   )

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: package includes convenience geoms built-Catppuccin colors:
code: set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  # Points default to blue ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg)) +   geom_catppuccin_point(size = 3) +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(title = "Using geom_catppuccin_point()") # Bars default to mauve ggplot(mpg, aes(class)) +   geom_catppuccin_bar() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(title = "Using geom_catppuccin_bar()") #> Warning in ggplot2::geom_bar(mapping = mapping, data = data, fill = fill, : #> Ignoring empty aesthetic: `width`.

title: Getting Started with ggcatppuccin
text: Learn customization options See gallery examples Learn R Markdown integration

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: ggcatppuccin can style just plots, entire R Markdown Quarto document using CSS generated Catppuccin palettes.

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: Use catppuccin_css() generate CSS string, write_catppuccin_css() write file: Write file:
code: library(ggcatppuccin)  # Generate CSS string css_text <- catppuccin_css("mocha") cat(substr(css_text, 1, 200), "...") #> :root { #>   --catppuccin-base: #1e1e2e; #>   --catppuccin-surface: #313244; #>   --catppuccin-text: #cdd6f4; #>   --catppuccin-subtext: #bac2de; #>   --catppuccin-accent: #cba6f7; #> } #>  #> body { #>   background-color: var( ... write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css", flavor = "mocha")

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: R Markdown YAML header: custom knit hook: reference :
code: --- title: "My Document" output:   html_document:     css: catppuccin.css --- --- title: "My Document" output: html_document ---  ```{r setup, include=FALSE} library(ggcatppuccin) write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css", flavor = "mocha") ``` --- title: "My Document" output:   html_document:     css: catppuccin.css ---

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: Quarto documents: generate dynamically:
code: --- title: "My Document" format:   html:     css: catppuccin.css --- ```{r} #| include: false library(ggcatppuccin) write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css", flavor = "latte") ```

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: Set flavor use throughout:
code: ```{r setup, include=FALSE} library(ggplot2) library(ggcatppuccin)  # Set flavor for session set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  # Generate matching CSS write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css") ```  Now all plots and the document styling will match:  ```{r} ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +  # Uses macchiato   theme_catppuccin()           # Uses macchiato ```

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: generated CSS styles: Body background - Uses base color Text color - Uses text color Links - Uses accent color (mauve) Code blocks - Uses surface0 background Blockquotes - Uses accent border surface0 background

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: ’s complete example:
code: --- title: "Analysis Report" author: "Your Name" date: "2026-01-18" output:   html_document:     css: catppuccin.css ---  ```{r setup, include=FALSE} library(ggplot2) library(ggcatppuccin)  set_catppuccin_flavor("frappe") write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css")  knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE, fig.width = 7, fig.height = 4) ```  ## Overview  This report uses the **Catppuccin Frappé** theme throughout.  ## Analysis  ```{r} ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 2) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(title = "Iris Dataset Analysis") ```  > Note: All colors are coordinated using the Catppuccin palette.  ## Code Example  ```{r} summary(iris) ```

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: Latte - Light theme, good printing Frappé - Balanced, works well screens Macchiato - Darker, easier eyes low light Mocha - Darkest, best dark mode enthusiasts

title: R Markdown and Quarto Integration
text: Consistency: Use set_catppuccin_flavor() start File location: Keep CSS file directory .Rmd Version control: Optionally add *.css .gitignore generating dynamically Testing: Preview different flavors see works best

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zhenya Kosovan. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Kosovan Z (2026). ggcatppuccin: Helper Function ggplot2. R package version 1.0.0, https://zhenyakosovan.github.io/ggcatppuccin.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggcatppuccin: Helper Function for ggplot2},   author = {Zhenya Kosovan},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://zhenyakosovan.github.io/ggcatppuccin}, }

what: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
text: Catppuccin palettes matching ggplot2 theme quickly styling plots across four flavors: Latte, Frappe, Macchiato, Mocha. Discrete color fill scales pair theme_catppuccin() backgrounds, text, grid lines stay coordinated.

title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
text: package yet CRAN; install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("ZhenyaKosovan/ggcatppuccin")

title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
text: Pick flavor (default "mocha") apply theme plus color fill scale. helper lets set session-wide default flavor want plots match.  Use scale_fill_catppuccin() geoms use fill aesthetics, switch flavors needed:  raw hex values available catppuccin_flavors need access individual colors directly.
code: library(ggplot2) library(ggcatppuccin)  set_catppuccin_flavor("macchiato")  ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +   geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 2.4) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin() +   labs(     title = "Fuel efficiency by engine size",     subtitle = "Catppuccin Macchiato palette via ggcatppuccin",     x = "Displacement (liters)",     y = "Highway MPG",     color = "Class"   ) ggplot(mpg, aes(class, fill = class)) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin(flavor = "latte") +   theme_catppuccin(flavor = "latte") +   guides(fill = "none") +   labs(     title = "Vehicle classes in mpg",     subtitle = "Latte flavor",     x = NULL,     y = "Count"   )

title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
text: geom_catppuccin_point() geom_catppuccin_col() small wrappers around standard geoms default Catppuccin accent colors:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(wt, mpg, color = factor(gear))) +   geom_catppuccin_point(flavor = "macchiato") +   scale_color_catppuccin("macchiato") +   theme_catppuccin("macchiato")

title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
text: Generate CSS snippet document point YAML:
code: write_catppuccin_css("catppuccin.css", flavor = "latte") format:   html:     css: catppuccin.css

title: Catppuccin themes and palettes for ggplot2
code: library(patchwork)  flavors <- c("latte", "frappe", "macchiato", "mocha")  plot_flavor <- function(flavor) {   ggplot(mpg, aes(displ, hwy, color = class)) +     geom_point(size = 2, alpha = 0.75) +     scale_color_catppuccin(flavor = flavor) +     theme_catppuccin(flavor = flavor) +     guides(color = "none") +     labs(       title = paste("Catppuccin", tools::toTitleCase(flavor)),       x = "Displacement",       y = "Highway MPG"     ) }  plots <- lapply(flavors, plot_flavor)  # 2x2 grid of flavors (plots[[1]] | plots[[2]]) /   (plots[[3]] | plots[[4]])

what: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
title: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
text: Generate small CSS theme based Catppuccin palettes can used R Markdown Quarto documents. CSS sets body background, text, heading, link, code block colors using chosen flavor.

title: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
code: catppuccin_css(flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"))  write_catppuccin_css(   path = "catppuccin.css",   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha") )

title: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. path File path CSS written.

title: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
text: catppuccin_css() returns single string containing CSS. write_catppuccin_css() writes CSS file invisibly returns normalized file path.

title: Catppuccin CSS for R Markdown and Quarto — catppuccin_css
code: css_text <- catppuccin_css("latte") cat(substr(css_text, 1, 80)) #> :root { #>   --catppuccin-base: #eff1f5; #>   --catppuccin-surface: #ccd0da; #>   --catpp  # Write a CSS file you can point to from Quarto/R Markdown css_file <- tempfile(fileext = ".css") write_catppuccin_css(css_file, flavor = "mocha") file.exists(css_file) #> [1] TRUE

title: Catppuccin Color Palettes — catppuccin_flavors
text: named list containing hex color codes four Catppuccin flavors: Latte, Frappe, Macchiato, Mocha. flavor contains set palette elements, matching official Catppuccin design system.

title: Catppuccin Color Palettes — catppuccin_flavors
code: catppuccin_flavors

title: Catppuccin Color Palettes — catppuccin_flavors
text: object class list length 4.

title: Catppuccin Color Palettes — catppuccin_flavors
text: named list flavors, named list hex strings.

title: Catppuccin Color Palettes — catppuccin_flavors
code: catppuccin_flavors$mocha$blue #> [1] "#89b4fa" names(catppuccin_flavors$latte) #>  [1] "base"     "mantle"   "text"     "subtext1" "subtext0" "overlay2" #>  [7] "surface0" "red"      "peach"    "yellow"   "green"    "blue"     #> [13] "lavender" "mauve"

title: Extract Catppuccin Palette Colors — catppuccin_palette
text: Extract vector color hex codes Catppuccin flavor. Useful manual color selection creating custom scales.

title: Extract Catppuccin Palette Colors — catppuccin_palette
code: catppuccin_palette(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   colors = NULL )

title: Extract Catppuccin Palette Colors — catppuccin_palette
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. colors Character vector color names extract. NULL (default), returns accent colors standard palette order.

title: Extract Catppuccin Palette Colors — catppuccin_palette
text: named character vector hex color codes.

title: Extract Catppuccin Palette Colors — catppuccin_palette
code: # Get all accent colors catppuccin_palette("mocha") #> [1] "#89b4fa" "#cba6f7" "#f38ba8" "#a6e3a1" "#fab387" "#f9e2af" "#b4befe"  # Get specific colors catppuccin_palette("latte", c("blue", "red", "green")) #> [1] "#1e66f5" "#d20f39" "#40a02b"  # Use in custom plot my_colors <- catppuccin_palette("frappe", c("mauve", "peach"))

title: Compare Catppuccin Flavors — compare_flavors
text: Create visual comparison four Catppuccin flavors side side. Useful choosing flavor use plots.

title: Compare Catppuccin Flavors — compare_flavors
code: compare_flavors(type = c("accents", "all"))

title: Compare Catppuccin Flavors — compare_flavors
text: type Type colors compare: "accents" (default) "".

title: Compare Catppuccin Flavors — compare_flavors
text: ggplot2 object showing four flavors.

title: Compare Catppuccin Flavors — compare_flavors
code: # Compare accent colors across flavors compare_flavors()   # Compare all colors compare_flavors(type = "all")

title: Catppuccin Geom Helpers — geom_catppuccin_point
text: Convenience wrappers around standard ggplot2 geoms default Catppuccin colors can get styled plot without manually setting aesthetics time.

title: Catppuccin Geom Helpers — geom_catppuccin_point
code: geom_catppuccin_point(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   color = NULL,   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_catppuccin_col(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   fill = NULL,   color = NA,   ...,   position = "stack",   width = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_catppuccin_line(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   color = NULL,   linewidth = NULL,   linetype = 1,   ...,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_catppuccin_bar(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   fill = NULL,   color = NA,   ...,   position = "stack",   width = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_catppuccin_boxplot(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   fill = NULL,   color = NULL,   ...,   outlier.colour = NULL,   outlier.fill = NULL,   outlier.shape = 19,   outlier.size = 1.5,   outlier.stroke = 0.5,   outlier.alpha = NULL,   notch = FALSE,   notchwidth = 0.5,   staplewidth = 0,   varwidth = FALSE,   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )  geom_catppuccin_violin(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   fill = NULL,   color = NULL,   ...,   trim = TRUE,   scale = "area",   na.rm = FALSE,   orientation = NA,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE )

title: Catppuccin Geom Helpers — geom_catppuccin_point
text: mapping, data, position, na.rm, show.legend, inherit.aes, ... Standard ggplot2 geom parameters. See corresponding ggplot2 geom documentation details. flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. color, colour Default point/line/border color; falls back Catppuccin accent NULL. fill Default fill color; falls back Catppuccin accent NULL. width Bar/column width. orientation Orientation geom ("x" "y"). linewidth, linetype Line width type line geoms. outlier.colour, outlier.fill, outlier.shape, outlier.size, outlier.stroke, outlier.alpha Aesthetics outliers boxplots. notch, notchwidth, staplewidth, varwidth Boxplot parameters. trim, scale Violin plot parameters.

title: Catppuccin Geom Helpers — geom_catppuccin_point
text: ggplot2 layer object.

title: Catppuccin Geom Helpers — geom_catppuccin_point
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_catppuccin_point() +   scale_color_catppuccin()   ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), mpg)) +   geom_catppuccin_col() #> Warning: Ignoring empty aesthetic: `width`.

title: Catppuccin Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin
text: ggplot2 discrete color fill scales use Catppuccin palette. palette order kept consistent across flavors.

title: Catppuccin Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin
code: scale_color_catppuccin(flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"), ...)  scale_fill_catppuccin(flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"), ...)  scale_color_catppuccin_d(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   ... )  scale_fill_catppuccin_d(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   ... )

title: Catppuccin Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin
text: flavor flavor Catppuccin use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale().

title: Catppuccin Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin
text: ggplot2 discrete scale object.

title: Catppuccin Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(factor(cyl), fill = factor(gear))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_catppuccin("macchiato") +   theme_minimal()

title: Catppuccin Continuous Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_c
text: Continuous color fill scales interpolate Catppuccin colors. Creates smooth gradients suitable numeric data.

title: Catppuccin Continuous Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_c
code: scale_color_catppuccin_c(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   ... )  scale_fill_catppuccin_c(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   ... )

title: Catppuccin Continuous Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_c
text: flavor flavor Catppuccin use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient() ggplot2::scale_fill_gradient().

title: Catppuccin Continuous Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_c
text: ggplot2 continuous scale object.

title: Catppuccin Continuous Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_c
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_c("mocha") +   theme_catppuccin("mocha")

title: Catppuccin Diverging Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_diverging
text: Diverging color fill scales use Catppuccin colors neutral midpoint, suitable data meaningful center point.

title: Catppuccin Diverging Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_diverging
code: scale_color_catppuccin_diverging(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   low_color = "blue",   high_color = "red",   midpoint = 0,   ... )  scale_fill_catppuccin_diverging(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   low_color = "blue",   high_color = "red",   midpoint = 0,   ... )

title: Catppuccin Diverging Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_diverging
text: flavor flavor Catppuccin use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. low_color Color low end ("blue", "mauve", "red", "green", "peach", "yellow", "lavender"). Defaults "blue". high_color Color high end. Defaults "red". midpoint midpoint value diverging scale. Defaults 0. ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient2().

title: Catppuccin Diverging Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_diverging
text: ggplot2 continuous scale object.

title: Catppuccin Diverging Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_diverging
code: library(ggplot2)  df <- data.frame(   x = rep(1:10, 10),   y = rep(1:10, each = 10),   z = rnorm(100) )  ggplot(df, aes(x, y, fill = z)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_diverging("mocha") +   theme_catppuccin("mocha")

title: Catppuccin Sequential Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_sequential
text: Sequential color fill scales create gradient base color chosen accent color, suitable showing ordered numeric data.

title: Catppuccin Sequential Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_sequential
code: scale_color_catppuccin_sequential(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   accent = "blue",   ... )  scale_fill_catppuccin_sequential(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   accent = "blue",   ... )

title: Catppuccin Sequential Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_sequential
text: flavor flavor Catppuccin use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. accent accent color use high end ("blue", "mauve", "red", "green", "peach", "yellow", "lavender"). Defaults "blue". ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::scale_color_gradient().

title: Catppuccin Sequential Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_sequential
text: ggplot2 continuous scale object.

title: Catppuccin Sequential Color Scales — scale_color_catppuccin_sequential
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_sequential("mocha", accent = "mauve") +   theme_catppuccin("mocha")

title: Set Global Catppuccin Flavor — set_catppuccin_flavor
text: Sets preferred Catppuccin flavor R session, subsequent calls scales themes can omit flavor argument read option.

title: Set Global Catppuccin Flavor — set_catppuccin_flavor
code: set_catppuccin_flavor(flavor)

title: Set Global Catppuccin Flavor — set_catppuccin_flavor
text: flavor Flavor name store (e.g. "mocha"). validation applied.

title: Set Global Catppuccin Flavor — set_catppuccin_flavor
text: Invisibly returns previous value option.

title: Show Catppuccin Palette Colors — show_catppuccin_palette
text: Display colors Catppuccin flavor visual swatch. Useful exploring available colors choosing custom color combinations.

title: Show Catppuccin Palette Colors — show_catppuccin_palette
code: show_catppuccin_palette(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   type = c("all", "accents", "neutrals") )

title: Show Catppuccin Palette Colors — show_catppuccin_palette
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. type Type colors show: "" colors, "accents" just accent colors, "neutrals" base/text/surface colors.

title: Show Catppuccin Palette Colors — show_catppuccin_palette
text: ggplot2 object showing color palette.

title: Show Catppuccin Palette Colors — show_catppuccin_palette
code: # Show all colors show_catppuccin_palette("mocha")   # Show just accent colors show_catppuccin_palette("latte", type = "accents")   # Show just neutrals show_catppuccin_palette("frappe", type = "neutrals")

title: Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin
text: minimal ggplot2 theme applies Catppuccin colors text, backgrounds, grid lines. default flavor "mocha", official flavors available.

title: Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin
code: theme_catppuccin(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   base_size = 12,   base_family = "sans" )

title: Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. base_size Base font size passed ggplot2::theme_minimal(). base_family Base font family passed ggplot2::theme_minimal().

title: Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin
text: ggplot2 theme object.

title: Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin("latte")

what: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
title: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
text: even minimal theme theme_catppuccin(), grid lines default. Useful presentations want maximum focus data.

title: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
code: theme_catppuccin_minimal(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   base_size = 12,   base_family = "sans",   grid = c("none", "major", "minor", "both") )

title: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. base_size Base font size passed ggplot2::theme_minimal(). base_family Base font family passed ggplot2::theme_minimal(). grid grid lines show: "none" (default), "major", "minor", "".

title: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
text: ggplot2 theme object.

title: Minimal Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_minimal
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(mtcars, aes(mpg, wt, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_catppuccin() +   theme_catppuccin_minimal("mocha")

what: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
title: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
text: completely minimal theme axes, grid, text elements except title. Ideal maps, images, highly stylized visualizations.

title: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
code: theme_catppuccin_void(   flavor = getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor", "mocha"),   base_size = 12,   base_family = "sans" )

title: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
text: flavor Catppuccin flavor use ("mocha", "latte", "frappe", "macchiato"). Defaults value set set_catppuccin_flavor(), "mocha" set. base_size Base font size title. base_family Base font family title.

title: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
text: ggplot2 theme object.

title: Void Catppuccin Theme for ggplot2 — theme_catppuccin_void
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(faithfuld, aes(waiting, eruptions, fill = density)) +   geom_tile() +   scale_fill_catppuccin_c() +   theme_catppuccin_void() +   labs(title = "Old Faithful Eruption Density")

title: ggcatppuccin 1.0.0
text: Added continuous color scales scale_color_catppuccin_c() scale_fill_catppuccin_c() Added diverging scales scale_color_catppuccin_diverging() scale_fill_catppuccin_diverging() Added sequential scales scale_color_catppuccin_sequential() scale_fill_catppuccin_sequential() Added explicit discrete scale aliases scale_color_catppuccin_d() scale_fill_catppuccin_d() Added additional geom wrappers: geom_catppuccin_line(), geom_catppuccin_bar(), geom_catppuccin_boxplot(), geom_catppuccin_violin() Added theme variants: theme_catppuccin_minimal() theme_catppuccin_void() Added palette utility functions: show_catppuccin_palette(), catppuccin_palette(), compare_flavors()

title: ggcatppuccin 1.0.0
text: Fixed set_catppuccin_flavor() actually work - functions now respect global flavor option Functions now check getOption("ggcatppuccin.flavor") fall back “mocha” set Explicit flavor parameter still overrides global option

title: ggcatppuccin 1.0.0
text: Added vignettes getting started, customization, R Markdown integration, gallery Improved function documentation examples cross-references Enhanced README comparison images troubleshooting section Added CLAUDE.md AI-assisted development

title: ggcatppuccin 1.0.0
text: Expanded test coverage new features Added tests global flavor option behavior Improved code quality based lintr recommendations
